column5: i live in oregon and we've been vote by mail since the early 90s but there's a lot of checks and balances that are involved in that. one of them is is my signature has to match and it has to come from the zip code that i live in or i have to drop it off at election office and then that signature is actually checked against a signature card at the state and city level. so we've done it for so long. it's very mature but the what happened i think recently with the other states that tried to do it and just basically any ballot the showed up was counted with no verification.
